name: inclinable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
likely to do or to want to do something, or likely to be persuaded to do something: inclinable to Such people were believed to be more inclinable to disputes and civil wars. They focused on individuals they thought may be inclinable to join a rebellion.
More examplesFewer examplesThe children were young, and inclinable to virtue and learning.I never found her inclinable to think herself at fault. The typical habitat is described, in order to assist people inclinable to cultivate these medicinal plants.
